name: Ana Maria Paranhos de Amorim
about-1: I hold a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the Federal University of Bahia (UFBA), a Master's degree in Systems and Computing from UNIFACS, a specialization in Distributed Systems from UFBA, and a Bachelor's degree in Data Processing from UFBA.
about-2: Member of the CEManTIKA research group on Collaborative, Ubiquitous, and Context-Aware Systems. I participated as a member of the RESCUER project, a Crowdsourcing solution for crisis and emergency management, funded by the European Commission and CNPq/MCTI, developed in partnership between Brazil and the European Union.
about-3: Currently (2025), I am a research fellow at the Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais - INPE (National Institute for Space Research). I have been working in the field of Computer Science since 1980. My research interests include Crowdsourcing, Software Engineering, Mobile Objects, Collaborative Systems, and Crisis and Emergency Management Systems.
about-4: I am focused on research and Front-End development, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React to create modern and responsive interfaces.
project1-desc: Personal website created to showcase my projects and professional information.
project3-desc: Full stack project - frontend, backend and database.
project3-tech: Technologies: BD: MongoDB; Backend: Node.js + MongoDB; Frontend: React
footer: © 2025 Ana Maria Paranhos de Amorim. All rights reserved.
